title: Font Search: Franco
content: I am looking for a font named "Franco" It is an italicized serif font, with a script lowercase "S". The capital and lowercase G and Y have hooked/looped bottoms. It is not a script font, except for the lowercase s.
author: Sidelines

comments.content: Do you have a sample which you could share with us?

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017110449im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Franco%20Sample_5194.jpg)

I hope this sample is clear enough,
From where did you get this sample? It looks quite old.

I think it is one of those fonts used by invitation/wedding companies  
_EDIT it is_  
 [http://www.invitationconsultants.com/f/fonts.aspx?p\_site=wis](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017110449/http:/www.invitationconsultants.com/f/fonts.aspx?p_site=wis "http://www.invitationconsultants.com/f/fonts.aspx?p\_site=wis")

Tim

It is used by those companies. BUT...I need it to address envelopes for invitations produced by one of those companies. They will tell me nothing! So....I have to find it myself. That is why I am asking for help.

One can find it with a simple search, I am unwilling to put up a link because some of the fonts offered in the same package are renamed and the price of the package seem to be too good to be true/legal.  
Tim

sidelines - were u able to find this franco font?  
timd - can u email me that link?  
pattyfab - odette "Y" is totally different

any other suggestions on where we can purchase this font?

Joshua, it is almost three years ago, sorry you'll have to do your own search I cannot recall where it was.

Tim
Anybody willing to help take this challenge to identify the origin of this mysterious font called "franco" that can't seems to be locate anywhere to purchase?
